products.short_description: Deploy a free, static website using this sample deployable architecture. Includes a GitLab repository for source code control.
products.long_description: This sample deployable architecture creates a static website hosted by using IBM Cloud Object Storage. The Terraform template deploys a IBM Cloud Object Storage bucket, a GitLab repository for the website source, and a toolchain that deploys the code from GitLab to the storage bucket when changes are made. Select a new or existing GitLab repository, as well as what branch to watch. The URL of the static website is provided as an output after you deploy it.

flavors.usage:
export ibmcloud_api_key=<ibm user api key>
export git_token<user git token>
export region=us-south
export resource_group=default
export cos_bucket_name=mybucketname
terraform plan

diagrams.description:
This sample deployable architecture creates a free, static website as a proof of concept. It uses the IBM Cloud terraform provider to create the following:

- An IBM Cloud Object Storage (COS) bucket configured for public web access
- A toolchain that provides a hosted GitLab repository to store a static website html
- A simple pipeline that copies that HTML to the Object Storage bucket when the main branch is updated

The result is a simple static website with its source stored in a GitLab repository that's automatically updated when the repository is updated.

configuration.description: Enter a name for the new repository that's created to store your application files.

Name the bucket that will be created on your IBM Cloud Object Storage instance. Bucket names must be globally unique across IBM Cloud, and must be 3-63 characters in length. The name can include lowercase alphanumeric characters as well as nonconsecutive dashes and hyphens, but must start and end with alphanumeric characters.
Give your IBM Cloud Object Storage instance a unique name. Lite accounts are limited to one instance of Object Storage, so you might need to delete an existing instance.
Enter a plan type for your IBM Cloud Object Storage instance. The Lite plan is recommended for most users.
Enter an API key you will use to deploy.
Provide a GitLab access token from your account.
Enter the region where you'd like to deploy your resources.
Enter the name of the resource group that will contain your resources when you deploy them.
